contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox river | name = Two Medicine River | image_name =Empire Builder @Two Medicine Trestle ( 2 Views ).jpg | image_size = 300px | image_alt = | caption = [[Amtrak]]'s ''[[Empire Builder]]'' crosses the Two Medicine River near [[East Glacier Park, Montana|East Glacier Park]] in 2011. | image_map = Mt-rivers.gif | map_size = | map_alt = | map_caption = Montana rivers with Two Medicine in the north central | origin = {{coord|48|29|32|N|113|15|49|W|display=inline|name=Two Medicine River}}<ref name=gnis/> | mouth = {{coord|48|29|11|N|112|13|40|W|display=title,inline|name=Two Medicine River}}<ref name=gnis>{{cite gnis |id=792559 |name=Two Medicine River}}</ref> | basin_countries = [[Pondera County, Montana|Pondera]] and [[Glacier County, Montana]] | progression = | length = | elevation = | mouth_elevation = {{convert|3294|ft|m}}<ref name=gnis/> | discharge = | watershed = | river_system = [[Missouri River]] | left_tribs = | right_tribs = }} The '''Two Medicine River''' is a tributary of the [[Marias River]], approximately 60 mi (97 km) long, in northwestern [[Montana]] in the [[United States]]. It rises in the [[Rocky Mountain Front]] in [[Glacier National Park (U.S.)|Glacier National Park]] at the [[continental divide]] and flows east, down from the mountains and across the [[Blackfeet Indian Reservation]]. It receives [[Birch Creek (Montana)|Birch Creek]] in southeastern [[Glacier County, Montana|Glacier County]] and joins [[Cut Bank Creek]] to form the Marias, approximately 12 mi (19 km) southeast of [[Cut Bank, Montana|Cut Bank]]. ==See also== *[[List of rivers of Montana]] *[[Montana Stream Access Law]] ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{Montana}} [[Category:Glacier National Park (U.S.)]] [[Category:Rivers of Montana]] [[Category:Landforms of Glacier County, Montana]] [[Category:Landforms of Pondera County, Montana]]
